de.weltraumschaf.jebnf.parser
Class EbnfParser

java.lang.Object
  de.weltraumschaf.jebnf.parser.EbnfParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
Parser
public class EbnfParser
extends Object
implements Parser

Parses a stream of EBNF tokens and generate a abstract syntax tree.

Author:
Sven Strittmatter

Field Detail

FACTOR_OPERATORS

private static final List<TokenType> FACTOR_OPERATORS
All other operator tokens. {'.', '=', '|', ')', ']', '}'}

Method Detail

parse

public Syntax parse()
             throws SyntaxException,
                    IOException
Parses the EBNF tokens and returns a syntax AST. On semantic syntax errors a SyntaxError will be thrown.

Specified by:
parse in interface Parser
Returns:
Return the parsed syntax tree.
Throws:
SyntaxException - If the parser encounter bad syntax.
IOException - On IO errors of the parsed source.

parseRule

private Node parseRule()
                throws SyntaxException,
                       IOException
Parses an EBNF production: rule = identifier ( "=" | ":==" | ":" ) expression ( "." | ";" ) .

Returns:
Return parsed rule node. Type of node is NodeType#RULE.
Throws:
SyntaxException - If the parser encounter bad syntax.
IOException - On IO errors of the parsed source.

                      throws SyntaxException,

parent - Parent node.
Returns:
Return parsed expression node.
Throws:

IOException - On IO errors of the parsed source.

                throws SyntaxException,

Parses an EBNF term: term = factor { factor } .

parseFactor

private Node parseFactor(Node parent)
                  throws SyntaxException,
                         IOException
Parses an EBNF factor: factor = identifier | literal | "[" expression "]" | "(" expression ")" | "{" expression "}" .

Parameters:

assertToken

protected boolean assertToken(Token token,
                              TokenType type,
                              String value)
Checks whether a token is of a type and is equal to a string literal or not.

Parameters:
token - Token to assert.
type - Token type to assert against.
value - Token value to assert against.
Returns:
Return true if the passed token is of passed type and has passed string as value, unless false.

assertTokens

protected boolean assertTokens(Token token,
                               TokenType type,
                               List<String> values)
Checks whether a token is of a type and is equal to a array of string literal or not.

Parameters:
token - Token to assert.
type - type to assert against.
values - Array of strings.
Returns:
Return true if the passed token is of passed type and has one of the passed strings as value, unless false.

raiseError

protected void raiseError(String msg)
                   throws SyntaxException
Raises an error on the scanner's current token position.

Parameters:
msg - Describes the raised error.
Throws:
SyntaxException - Throws always an exception.

raiseError

protected void raiseError(String msg,
                          Position pos)
                   throws SyntaxException
Helper to raise syntax errors. If no position is passed the one of the current token is used.

Parameters:
msg - Describes the raised error.
pos - The position where the error occurred in the source.
Throws:
SyntaxException - Throws always an exception.
